name: Final Slam 2
description: 2D Casual fighting game where you can create and customize your fighter (80 slots to save your avatars) with tons of different options and get ready to fight into the Championship. Final Slam 2 is a PC fighting game that allows you to create your own fighter and win the Final Slam championships or play through the official Final Slam...

reviews.review_text: dont buy this...period.(if you are looking for a more in depth review, the game is basically a flash game that goes full screen and not only that but its extremely difficult for no reason, whether or not you win a fight is completely up to the bot you are facing and whether he wants you to win or not, the damage for attacks arent fixed and special moves can sometimes take away all your heatlth, who would want to play this??)
Who could ever programmed this pile of crap?

Let's see: No controller support for a fighter game, some animations run on a literal frame per second, every mode is just a button mash to victory, drawn by a child and so wooden it feels like smacking Pinocchio around. No idea why anyone would pick this mess over any functional fighter. Creating your own piece of failure? I guess that's a whole new level of dedication. I wouldn't.

Here's my final slam of Final Slam: this game bites. Do not buy it unless it's part of a bundle with other things you want. Maybe some fans of some early 2D fighting games like Karate Champ might think it's OK, but I'm not even convinced that they'd find it all that great.  3/10 - avoid buying unless it's super cheap and you can sell the cards to recoup the cost of the purchase.
Pros  - Cards  Cons  - poor control  - bad graphics  - nothing attract to play again  1/10

It's recommended if you are into retro fighting games, it made me remember when I played the king of fighters '94 or art of fighting. This more a game about what basic moves to use in the right moment than a game of using powers or special abilities,
Love the customization feature so far. I like this game. It is small but very effective.

Usually don't post reviews but I can't help it. I got this game for free with admittedly high expectations as I had gotten like 3 really good free games in a row. In theory it sounded great. Simple fighting game with a story and full character customization with 80 whole spots to save them in. Well ♥♥♥♥.   First thing is the character customization and everything else looks like crap. All of it. Which is very disappointing because I love making custom characters. I don't doubt that somebody tried, it has a ton of options, but knowing your game looks like that why would you think that I would make 80 characters? And girl fighters are out of the question, they look like dudes regardless of choosing 'female'. Probably why they showed the character creator running at the speed of light in the tutorial. Alright fine, I made my dumb looking character now I get to make him punch things. Except wait, all of these moves look horribly unnatural. Whatever, I guess he's just dumb, It'll probably look better with game play. Except no, again, the graphics are entirely horrible and the bots will spam throughout the entire match. The only way to beat them half of the time is with more spam with the moves you picked that are meaningless anyway. Why? Because you can punch the guy all day and the second he decides he doesnt want to lose, halfway through the fight, his punches that used to barely dent your health bar suddenly obliterate it. I can't say the story was any good either because I don't even know for sure what it is. What I can get from it is overused nonsense that can't decide what genre it wants to be. Angsty sports movie conversation, therefore you have to win the tournament! Random robot battle! Steryotypical Asians doing wise Asian things! Suddenly magic! And also the apocalypse so now screw the tournament, save the world  You can't say I didnt try to play it, I played long enough for my card drops at least, but this is the worst game i've ever played. Ever. No contest except maybe with another free game I recieved around the same time as this one but I guess I can't complain to much because, you know, free. Holy ♥♥♥♥ they want $10 for this? Under no circumstances should this be purchased with real money by anyone
